data.title: Dropping A-bombs on newest bleed looks weird
data.body:
I didn't pay much attention before, but I think it just started doing it when I pulled bleed today after two days. Does it happen to anyone else with the newest bleed?

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5747153/7788557/c9e9061c-0237-11e5-9ac4-857cf9798505.png)

data.title: Fixed make dependencies not copying the cached GeoLite2-Country.mmdb.gz into the root.

data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8149.

data.title: Fix inability to delete unpacked maps
data.body: Fixes #8234

data.title: Cannot delete unpacked custom maps from the map chooser
data.body:
```
System.UnauthorizedAccessException: /Users/paul/Library/Application Support/OpenRA/maps/ra/zeus is a directory
  at System.IO.File.Delete (System.String path) [0x0007b] in /private/tmp/source-mono-mac-4.0.0-branch/bockbuild-mono-4.0.0-branch/profiles/mono-mac-xamarin/build-root/mono-4.0.0/mcs/class/corlib/System.IO/File.cs:166 
  at OpenRA.Mods.Common.Widgets.Logic.MapChooserLogic.DeleteMap (System.String map) [0x0001e] in /Users/paul/src/OpenRA/OpenRA.Mods.Common//Widgets/Logic/MapChooserLogic.cs:276
```

I also think we should change "See the logs" to "See debug.log" in the error message when deletion fails for clarity.

data.title: Starting a game on a map that has just been downloaded/installed kicks the player
data.body:
Downloading, leaving the lobby, entering again and then starting the game works.

Looks like some state isn't updated properly.

The bug already exists in at least release-20150424. Haven't investigated further.

data.title: Fix OpenRA.Game.exe.config issues
data.body:
1. it got removed during `make clean`
2. it didn't get copied to `packaging/built`, so nsis couldn't find it and failed to produce a package.

data.title: Fix map chooser crashing the server creation dialog in cnc
Made projectiles accept empty to disable image or sequence
data.body:
In addition to accepting null.

I agree that syntax-wise negating a value with `-` looks cleaner, but considering even some developers (including myself) were not aware that this is even possible, I think it would be better if both work, since quite a few parts of the engine (and official mod yaml code) allow empty strings to disable inherited properties.

Follow-up on #8220.

data.title: Added a NuGet replacement script as fallback
data.body:
Closes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/7386.

Added a simple (no dependency resolution) `noget.sh` based upon https://gist.github.com/Phrohdoh/a4aae3982824e87fefb6.

NuGet on Unix is still a problem. It is either not packaged or broken: the certificate storage is fiddly to get right and the error messages that produces are confusing. Also somehow it is not behaving properly. For unexplained reasons the cloud servers often run into trouble breaking the builds so I enforce the replacement now until https://github.com/travis-ci/travis-ci/issues/3940 is resolved.

data.title: Added render trait documentation
data.body: I wrote some short descriptions to our various render https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Traits. Turned out what they do is not obvious to new modders.

data.title: Fix broken bridges being initialized with a non-zero HP value
data.body:
Fixes the second half of #8219. For an explanation, see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8219#issuecomment-104926466

As a side effect this also replaces invalid initial health values with 1 HP instead of 1% of MaxHP.

data.title: Dispose traits when destroying an actor.
data.body: This addresses some long-standing bogosity with our world/actor teardown logic.  Traits that implement `IDisposable` should now be cleaned up whenever their actor is permanently removed from the world.  Several traits that were previously forced to hook only death have been updated to use disposing instead.

data.title: Fix broken bridges being initialized with a non-zero HP value
data.body: Fixes the second half of #8219. For an explanation, see https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/8219#issuecomment-104926466

data.title: Implement proper disguise tooltips
data.body:
Currently the tooltips for spy are not very good. It is not possible to distinguish which spy is disguised as which unit. The tooltip of disguised units should be changed so that it shows both the original spy description and the one for the unit it is disguised as. I made a table of all possible disguises for a spy:
![spy_table](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/7784725/c5e9e0fa-0178-11e5-8352-4403509334d9.png)
Here's the .ods file:
https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B_dMvsHPqPZkeFNjdWJJdEtDZDg/view?usp=sharing

data.title: Fixed several broken YAML sequences
data.body: Split from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/7709 as requested. Only the sietch can actually trigger a crash. The rest is just cleaning up unused or misnamed sequences that can not bring down the game.

data.title: Fixed the AI not avoiding boats when searching for viable paradrop targets
data.body: Tries to lessen #6636 with the adjusting screws we already got.

data.title: Introduce a class for efficient tiled sprite rendering.
data.body:
`TerrainSpriteLayer` wraps a vertex buffer and state management that can be used for sprite map layers (terrain, resources, shroud, etc).  It also removes the assumptions about static map bounds, which is a step towards supporting map-scripted bound changes (needed for TS/RA2) and cordon manipulation in the new editor.

This pr introduces the new class and hooks it up for the terrain renderer.  There shouldn't be any significant perf or gameplay changes.  The real benefits will come in the next few prs that will use this for the shroud, resources, etc.

Pinging @chrisforbes and @RoosterDragon who are the best suited to review this.

data.title: Fix a crash in the ParaBomb weapon defintion
data.body:
Fixes #8219.
Fixes #8020.

```
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Unit `bomblet` does not have a sequence named `open`
```

Also the bridges cannot be repaired anymore. Might not be mission-specific, haven't tested that yet.

data.title: What would it take to run on Android?
data.body:
I may well not be the only one that would like to play OpenRA on their Android device. :)
I was wondering .. what would we need to do to compile OpenRA as an Android app?

As an example i see the [OpenTTD Android port](https://github.com/pelya/openttd-android) by @pelya. OpenTTD also uses SDL2 and looks the same on Android except for some button padding. Not sure what else came at play.

Another port reference i found are the insights in this 4-part blog series by Julien Jorge:
- [Porting a C++ game to Android, the case of Andy's Super Great Park](http://blog.stuff-o-matic.com/post/2013/09/07/Porting-a-C-game-to-Android%2C-the-case-of-Andy-s-Super-Great-Park)
- [ASGP's Android Port Part II: from SDL 1.2 to SDL 2](http://blog.stuff-o-matic.com/post/2013/09/15/ASGP-s-Android-Port-Part-II%3A-from-SDL-1.2-to-SDL-2.)
- [http://blog.stuff-o-matic.com/post/2013/10/08/ASGP-s-Android-Port-Part-III%3A-from-OpenGL-Direct-Mode-to-GLES](http://blog.stuff-o-matic.com/post/2013/10/08/ASGP-s-Android-Port-Part-III%3A-from-OpenGL-Direct-Mode-to-GLES)
- [ASGP's Android Port Part IV: building the APK](http://blog.stuff-o-matic.com/post/2013/10/20/ASGP-s-Android-Port-Part-IV%3A-building-the-APK)

Now ofcourse OpenRA is not written in C++.. Would that be a show stopper? Any other problems that may need attention?

data.title: Fix Disguise oversight.
Removed bogus traits from ra FLARE
data.body: As detected in #8123 (https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8123#discussion_r30552625, https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8123#discussion_r30552929).

data.title: Replacement of D2K mod static shellmap with a scripted shellmap
data.body: Complete replacement of the fixed-screen shellmap currently in use for a customized shellmap, taking original RA mod shellmap as basis. WIP, terrain is not 100% finished, needs corrections, some buildings on sand instead of rock, and repetitive terrain patterns. Some scripting fixes done when rules for structures were modified. Commit 0cc324e. Reference (don't mind the music, used D2K's score track in script): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Ioku0YT2F0

data.title: Render performance significantly worse on some hardware
data.body:
I doubt that OpenRA is at fault here (though SDL2 might be), but when it comes to Renderer performance, OpenRA performs over 2x slower on a GTX 960 with 352.84 drivers vs. a Radeon 7790 (last WHQL drivers).

Performance is far less consistent, too. Initially performance is normal, then ms per Render tick go up from ~5 to ~14ms for a short time-span, and over time these time-spans grow more frequent and longer until it's ~12-14ms/tick all the time (regardless of how much is going on on-screen, btw).
With my old Radeon 7790 I didn't have this performance issue, it breezed through at ~4-5ms all the time (latest release/bleed).

data.title: Added selection classes
data.body:
Option 3 from #7469 that would support the type of functionality proposed by @MustaphaTR:

http://ares-developers.github.io/Ares-docs/new/typeselect.html

Basically whenever the standard select-by-type functionality is supposed to be extended to select any custom class of selectable actors, these custom classes can be defined using the Class property of the Selectable trait.

If the basic idea is fine, I'd define any remaining selection classes in the YAMLs.

data.title: Fix legacy editor
data.body: Fixes #8175.

data.title: Veteran unit production & unlocking through spies.
data.body:
A stab at #7585.

~~Sample veteran unit (E1.upgraded) is defined (using GainsExperience trait, InitialExperience property) and its production made available through tech tree prerequisite (barracks.upgraded under Player.ProvidesPrerequisite (1)) that is normally disabled. The prerequisite gets enabled when a spy infiltrates the appropriate building (BARR or TENT) that has the InfiltrateForUpgrade trait which references the prerequisite trait definition (1) under Player.~~

~~In case the idea is OK, I'd remove the yaml entries and the improvised cameo, leaving just the logic, until the upgraded units' cameos are all available.~~

This PR basically introduces three things.
- Upgrading icons in the production queue.
- Spawning upgraded units.
- Triggering both these upgrades with spies.

data.title: Fixed a compilation error on Mono 2.10
data.body: Again revealed accidentally by https://build.opensuse.org/package/show/games:openra/development. Introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/8065.
